meanings.definition: A book containing the story of the Exodus from Egypt, read at the Passover Seder.
meanings.sent1: During Passover, families read haggadot to remember the story of leaving Egypt.
meanings.sent2: The haggadot were passed down through generations in the family.
meanings.sent3: The haggadot at the Seder were so old, they seemed to whisper the story themselves.
meanings.sent4: The haggadot opened a door to the past, inviting us to relive history.
meanings.sent5: The illustrations in the haggadot made the Exodus tale come alive.

meanings.definition: The plural form of haggadah, a Jewish text that sets forth the order of the Passover Seder.
meanings.sent1: At the Seder, everyone received haggadot to follow along.
meanings.sent2: The haggadot on the table were beautifully decorated with intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: When the haggadot were misplaced, chaos ensued at the Seder.
meanings.sent4: The haggadot stood as guides, leading us through the rituals of the evening.
meanings.sent5: The haggadot were like maps, showing the way through the Passover traditions.
